summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the reproduction of discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case due to Bates stamping errors. The emails discuss correcting document numbering and sending materials to defense counsel and Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Annie Phifer
persons.context: Addressed in email regarding reproduction of discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: William Bohrer
persons.context: Mentioned in email subject line regarding items to reproduce.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discovery materials are being reproduced and sent to her at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

connections.description: Phifer is involved in the legal process of providing discovery materials to Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Discovery Reproduction for Maxwell Case
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel coordinate to reproduce seven discovery items with corrected Bates numbers due to stamping errors, to be sent to defense counsel and Maxwell at MDC.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case required reproduction due to Bates stamping errors that caused numbering overlaps.
Seven items (one Excel file and six PDFs) were re-stamped with corrected control numbers SDNY_GM_02742184 through SDNY_GM_02742302.
Materials were to be sent to defense counsel and to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
The correspondence shows ongoing discovery obligations and procedural coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The emails reference prior productions (7th and 8th Productions) in the Maxwell case discovery process.
